content: indoor cat crochet presents the cat butt coasters abbreviations mc = magic_ring if you do not know how to do a magic_ring i follow this method https //www youtube com/watch v=geq48abhrzo chain = chain st = stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch fo = fasten_off supplies -any kind of worsted weight yarn will suffice the stock photos included multiple brands of yarn and each turns out similar in size so no worries -you will need a light pink for the middle and then any color you d like the cat s to be i personally modeled mine after my best friend s cats = -h hook 5 0mm hook *note if you use a different weight of yarn please change your hook size accordingly -needle for sewing in ends -optional stitch marker notes -gauge is not overly important my coasters typically turn out to be 4 25 in diameter however if you do have a tight gauge your cat tail may curl a bit and will need to be blocked refer to this video to learn how to block if you are unfamiliar with it https //www youtube com/watch v=drdfcegtqzm - to change the color i do so by pulling a chain through the loop that is currently on your hook after completing the slip_stitch see pic below in round 2 -each new round starts with a chain 2 this does not count as a stitch -do not turn the work unless told to do so -if you are a beginner and unfamiliar with working in the round i suggest using a chain marker so you can keep track of the beginning of your current row once you start a new round move the stitch marker up to the round you are actively working on pattern round 1 with the light pink create mc chain 2 6 half_double_crochet join ends with slip_stitch 6 st round 2 change to your new color chain 2 then 2 half_double_crochet in your 1st st then 2 half_double_crochet in each remaining st join with slip_stitch 12 st round 3 chain 2 then 1 half_double_crochet in 1st st *2 half_double_crochet in next st 1 half_double_crochet in the next st* repeat* until end join with slip_stitch 18 st round 4 chain 2 then 1 half_double_crochet in each of the first 2 st *2 half_double_crochet in next st 1 half_double_crochet in each of the next 2 st* repeat* to end join with slip_stitch 24 st round 5 chain 2 then 1 half_double_crochet in each of the 1st 3 st *2 half_double_crochet in next st 1 half_double_crochet in each of the next 3 st * repeat* until end join with slip_stitch 30 st round 6 chain 2 then 1 half_double_crochet in each of the 1st 4 st *2 half_double_crochet in next st 1 half_double_crochet in each of the next 4 st* repeat* until end join with slip_stitch 36 st to make tail stay attached with the slip_stitch from the previous round chain
